Comments:
Many mods and servers have disabled casting in Expertise mode. In that case, drop the two Expertise feats and add one more Greater Spell Focus.
The original build has Improved Combat Casting. I did not find room for that in this build, and in my opinion a high Concentration skill will avoid spell interruption and save your day most of the times.
The maxed Lore is from the original build, and I have stayed true to that here. Casting Identify should do the job, so feel free to choose other skills, perhaps Heal or Persuade.

For those not familiar with the Exalted Sorceress - this is a sorcerer that is empowered in several ways:
She is a high level Sorcerer with high Charisma and an Epic Spell Focus, securing spells with high DC and high spell penetration. She has the essential meta magic.
Paladin adds the Armor/Shield proficiency, the Discipline skill and the Divine Grace feat that has synergy with the high Charisma and grants greatly improved saves.
Monk adds one more dump of Discipline, The Tumble skill for added AC and the Evasion feat that helps avoid damage from many spells and effects.
Epic skill focus Discipline makes her very hard to knock down or disarm.
The Auto-Still feats let her cast in full armor with no arcane spell failure and with full meta magical freedom.

posts.author: Valerfor
posts.content:
Now, Mick, we all know how powerful the exalted sorceress is and for those who don't, I would say "go and play her now", but putting this thing into the 30's...Is even more ridiculous and it gives even fewer excuses for someone not having played one!

Well done, and I would like to see your suggestions (forget what the original build says, this is yours) about the secondary school focus and the replacement to "lore" skill. I would also be interested to know how the build plays in a level 30 limited environment based on your experience (if you have played it).

posts.author: Mick Dagger
posts.content:
If you drop the expertise feats, you can live with intelligence 12 and just drop the lore skill.
The two buy points can go to strength for better carrying capacity. After all you plan on equipping full plate and a shield, maybe even a tower shield.
It is also possible to start out with charisma 18 if you take intelligence 12 and dexterity 8. You can then end up with a final charisma of 26 if you are willing to swap one of the epic feats with great charisma. IMO it is not worth it, but it is an option.
Evocation is my prefered school #2. Some may prefer transmutation to make the Flesh to stone spell more dangerous. Dropping the expertise feats gives room for a second greater spell focus feat. I don't find room for one more epic spell focus feat here.

posts.author: Mick Dagger
posts.content:
@Valerfor:

 I would also be interested to know how the build plays in a level 30 limited environment based on your experience (if you have played it).
Like the exalted sorceress this is a build with a lot of defensive qualities, that are quite inexpensive: You drop 2 caster levels, but spell penetration is still quite good, even without the feats. You spend some feats on auto still and epic skill focus discipline. In other builds you can spend those feats on great charisma and improve the DC of all your spells by 2.  
Defensively the character feels as solid as a buffed fighter. In some extraordinary situations you may want that extra penetration and DC. But more often than not, casting the spell once more solves the problem.

I must admit that I have more experience with more "fragile" sorcerer builds with higher charisma and better DCs. But in some harsh environments I do certainly prefer the Exalted sorceress.

posts.author: Mick Dagger

Hi, calespurmarksman

There are some low level necro DC spells early on if you want to use them. Feel free to choose for yourself.

posts.content: For a new player, what strategy do you use with this build? What spells, and what Items should we be looking for?

posts.author: Freaky Grandma
posts.content:
A warm welcome to you, skeletonproblems!

How new is "new"?

Where do you intend to play this build? OC, expansions (SoU and HotU), a module or campaign (like Lord of Terror or Aielund) or a PW like Arelith (it is the only one I have heard of that has a level cap of 30)? The more people know, the easier it will be for them to help you and answer specific questions about items, spells and such.

If you haven't played the original campaign yet and this is what you intend to do, I would recommend that you either tweak this build a bit or look for another one. The OC ends around level 18 so that you won't ever get this monk level, not even the first paladin level.
The expansions will get you to mid-to-late twenties, level-wise, but you probably  still won't get this monk level. In case you knew all this already, sorry, it is hard to guess from your post if you are new to NWN or just new to power building.
